Legal_Issue: Whether refusal to perform military service constitutes grounds for refugee status or protection under IRPA
Decision_Level: Administrative decision by the Refugee Protection Division
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of administrative refugee determination
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, evidence on prison conditions, military service penalties
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to Convention refugee status and person in need of protection
Basis_of_Claim: Conscientious objection, fear of persecution for draft evasion
Evaluation_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution, risk to life, cruel and unusual treatment
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Punishment for draft evasion not disproportionate or inhumane; no link to Convention grounds
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection proceeding, followed by judicial review
Legal_Standard: Convention refugee under UN Refugee Convention, Person in need of protection under IRPA
Application_Factor: Nature of punishment, conditions of detention, connection to protected grounds
Decision_Outcome: Ozunal does not qualify as a Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the Board's conclusion reasonable regarding lack of persecution?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Article 1F of the Refugee Convention, IRPA s. 97(1)
Cause_of_Refusal: No evidence of persecution linked to Convention grounds; punishment considered proportionate
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 96, s. 97(1); Refugee Convention Article 1A(2)
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to prove association with persecuted groups or illegitimate military actions
Credibility_Issues: Applicant failed to establish subjective fear connected to objective basis
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim based on conscientious objection and risk upon return
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, United Nations Refugee Convention
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial application
